abstract: YouTube expands its mobile site to make the experience of watching videos on the go more like it is on the PC.
snippet: YouTube expands its mobile site to make the experience of watching videos on the go more like it is on the PC.
lead_paragraph: YouTube first dipped its toe in the mobile world in November of 2006 with a deal to deliver some video clips through the VCast service of Verizon Wireless. Last year it created a mobile Web site accessible on many Sprint and AT&T phones. But the site only carried a small slice of YouTube content. And it has another subset on the iPhone.
